Marco Rubio, then a Republican presidential candidate, in Cleveland in 2015.Aaron Josefczyk / Reuters file ‘He seemed like a totally normal, regular Republican’ Ambition drove Mandel more than ideology early in his career, and establishment Republicans who saw in him a young and polite Jewish veteran who clicked with swing voters were eager to accommodate his quick rise.
title: Josh Mandel foreshadowed Trump’s rise. His Ohio Senate bid is a test of what’s next.

sentence: Two Republican U.S. Senate candidates in Ohio spoke out strongly against the removal of Newsmax from the Midwestern telecom giant Cincinnati Bell in separate appearances Thursday on ''Spicer & Co.'' Josh Mandel, the former Ohio state treasurer, asserted that he would ''take on any company'' ... ''if they're trampling our First Amendment rights.''

title: Josh Mandel, Jane Timken Slam Cincinnati Bell for Dropping Newsmax

sentence: A debate between candidates running for Ohio's open Senate seat descended into chaos on Monday night as Republican Josh Mandel shared a testy exchange with an audience member over his past comments calling Black Lives Matter activists 'thugs.'

title: Chaos at Ohio Senate race debate as Republican Josh Mandel shouts at audience member who said he should be 'put out' for calling BLM 'thugs' and calls his Democratic rival 'like AOC only dumber'

Morgan Harper debate is going completely off the rails pic.twitter.com/DtZJZxmK40 — Tyler Buchanan (@Tylerjoelb) February 22, 2022 The moderator asked Mandel about a comment calling Black Lives Matter members “thugs.” Then an audience member interrupted with a loud “uhhhhuh.” “You ain’t coming in the Black community.

sentence: Both candidates are currently sitting atop the polls, with Josh Mandel being the consensus front-runner for months, and Gibbons coming on strong of late, surging to the top spot among GOP Senate candidates in two recent independent surveys.

sentence: Scroll down for video +6 View gallery Senate hopefuls Mike Gibbons, 69, (left, standing) and Josh Mandel, 44, (right) came toe-to-toe at the primary debate after Mandel attacked the father-of-five's financial assets in China, claiming he 'made millions' there +6 View gallery Mandel appeared irritated toward Gibbons - who's wealth ranges anywhere from $83milllion to $286million - said he didn't 'think I made millions off of anything' Gibbons went on to say that former Marine 'didn't know squat' because he's never worked in private sector, to which Mandel replied that he had served two tours in Iraq and told the businessman: 'Don't tell me I haven't worked.'
title: Should've been boring but... Republican Ohio Senate hopefuls and millionaires Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel nearly come to blows during primary debate about Chinese petroleum

sentence: “You’re dealing with the wrong guy,” Mandel says to Gibbons before calling him a “pussy.” pic.twitter.com/AbbyQpwXvu — Natalie Allison (@natalie_allison) March 18, 2022 Gibbons immediately tried to make political hay out of the tussle, calling Mandel “unfit” and “childlike.” Josh Mandel is unhinged, unfit, and flailing – because he’s losing.
